revised_title: The Effect of Refractive Index Changes in Linseed Oil on the Deterioration of Oil Paintings
tldr: The author investigates the change in refractive index of linseed oil during the drying process and its effect on the deterioration of oil paintings. They found that the increase in refractive index contributes to the lowering of tone in paintings, in addition to the yellowing of the oil. This discovery helps to understand the reasons behind the degradation of oil paintings and provides insights for artists and conservators to preserve and restore them.
